description:
Great Peet's location -- tied for first place as my favorite one. Staff are polite, drinks are made quickly, and the decor is great!

My only criticism is that the waiting area tends to meld with the ordering area which causes a lot of confusion for people coming in.
author: Mike W.

description: Kinda grouchy people work here. Not like normal coffee houses. You have to tolerate them. The lobby of the building is nice to meet up with friends though, so its ok if you can bear the unfriendly staff. maybe they will get some nice people there some day. its a great location though.
author: David A.

description:
I told the young female barista that I wanted a "half pound of decaf Major Dickason's and a half pound of Sumatra, ground (at #2), and put in one bag". She seemed to be half-listening, so I repeated the order after she charged my credit card. 

Instead of mixing the two 1/2-half pounds evenly in one one bag, I noticed she ground the decaf first, put it in the bag, then ground the Sumatra, and put it in the upper half of the bag, without mixing them together evenly. When she handed me the bag, I said, "you know, they're not mixed evenly", and she acknowledged that, but did nothing to fix the uneven mix; she just kinda shrugged her shoulders and said half-heartedly "it'll be all right". I wasn't gonna make a big deal over it, so took the 1-lb of coffee, and left the store, figuring I could mix them at home later. But when I got home later and looked at the labels she put on the bag, I saw that the Major Dickason's label did not state "Decaf", so now have a pound of coffee with twice the caffeine I requested (I consider it a wasted $16.50) ...geez, I'm so damn pissed at her. 

This particular Peet's (which I've been going to for years) has had some good folks on their staff; unfortunately, the barista who took my order tonight wasn't one of them.
author: Ed D.

description: RUDE! I was standing in line on my phone talking to my sister- waiting for my turn. I would have obviously hung up before getting to the cashier to order my drink- I know common courtesy!! The Caucasian brunette was rude and wouldn't call me- I hung up my call- she still ignored me. Then another guy says I'd do the same thing, I wouldn't help either... then they both started talking about me for no reason what so ever!! Absolutely rude and will never go back again. And to make matters worse my latte was cold!
author: Sandy M.

description:
The coffee is good. I am not a coffee snob. A medium or dark roast with a little cream is all I need. I rarely buy coffee. Paying for coffee is more like a luxury to me.

Why am I writing this review then? Well it was a super convenient location for me.

Most importantly, the Marble Bread and Citrus Bread - so good, so fluffy & moist, and sweet.
A good friend at work introduced me to Peet's marble bread. He had purchased 2 and decided that was too much for one person, so he was kind enough to share with me. Since then, I've been checking out every other Peet's to see if they have marble bread ... and they usually don't.

Since the FDA requires chains to list nutritional info, I checked it out on the website. It's not that bad, but I was happily ignorant not knowing the calories and macronutrient content.

The staff is always friendly, enthusiastic, and efficient. Efficiency is important for the caffeine-deficient crowd.

It looks like an average coffee shop, but head around to the back and chill out in the large open, public space. It is very bright, clean, and work friendly.
author: Joy W.

description: My tip for this location: have more than ONE person taking orders during the morning rush! Oh, and if you are going to have ONE person taking orders during morning rush, they shouldn't also have to be handing out the food and making oatmeal. It shouldn't take 20 min to get a drip cup of coffee.
author: Bradley V.

description:
Nice comfortable setting. I dropped by the cafe to get myself warmed up from the cold.  

The cafe has a big open layout. I'm assuming it gets really busy during lunch. I like the coffee chairs that they have laid out.  I got to enjoy my Chai and cookie while watching commuters going about with their day.  It feels so peaceful in here. And the chaos that goes about just steps from the front door seems a distance away.
author: Rochelle 'Shella' T.

description: Nothing was wrong with this place except for a guy named "immanuel".. I never personally met him nor know him, but he gave me dirty looks, says nothing when I asked him if he's alright, he simply ignored and continued to stare at me with his dirty looks.
author: Severus O.

description:
Expensive coffee with awful service. 

We basically got a coffee so I could pee. 

We waited 20 minutes for a coffee and the barista finally said what did you get? It took her 30 seconds to make my drink. 

Ridiculous.
author: Erin D.

description:
This place is clean, efficient, and my favorite coffee place in my area because the people here are so damn friendly. I'm not sure if they themselves are just downing all of their own delicious drinks all day or if they strictly hire engaging people at this location, but I have grown so fond of this spot that I finally ended my 3 year relationship with Starbucks!

Whereas Starbucks STILL doesn't know my name after coming in EVERY day for 3 years, (imagine "name, hon?" 720 times from the same person) the baristas here are very personal and know just how to make the perfect pick-me-ups for me and my coworkers. Working downtown where it's busy, bustling, stressful, and always about getting it done, that type of customer service is really refreshing and makes for a truly uplifting 10:30am coffee run. Special shoutout to barista Miguel B. who cracks us the hell up when we are stressed out as #*&$.  

Those who work here also take their drink making very seriously. I'm baffled by how much time they take to carefully froth, drizzle, and otherwise "craft" my drink in ways that look like an artist in the studio. I say this in a good way because, while they take their time to be precise, the lines are always efficiently moved along and I never have to wait. 

I'm so damn... impressed... and who gets impressed by a chain coffee shop these days?! Well done, Peet's on Mission. Well done and thank you.
author: Stephen D.

description: Was here for a business meeting and it worked out pretty well. We got a quiet spot, good friendly service and good coffee. This area has a sea of gourmet coffee shops like Blue Bottle and I am pleasantly surprised and happy to to see familiar oldies like Peet's still around.
author: Sunil R.

description: I really enjoy the people that work here. They are colorful and fun and some of them sing sometimes - truly a happy place to be.  I am usually in once or twice every work day and have never had a bad experience. The breakfast sandwiches have been a great addition and have not slowed things down, which is impressive. And the coffee is always solid and hot. Cheers to you Peet's folks - thanks for being a bright spot for those of us lucky enough to work close by.
author: Noelle F.

description:
Love Peet's, but I can't wrap my brain around the fact that a cup of cold brew costs twice as much as regular cup of iced coffee.  Seriously, order an iced coffee and they'll put ice in a cup and pour hot coffee over it.  Order a cold brew and they'll put ice in a cup and pour cold coffee over it, which makes a lot more sense in the grand scheme of things.

I make my own cold brew so I know there isn't any sort of sorcery going on.  What gives?
author: Kevin K.

description:
This team is amazing! Sparks my day! Angelita in particular is a gem!

It's usually clean and service is always kind and welcoming.
author: Cray V.

description:
I was meeting up with my friend and mentor for a morning cup o' coffee in SOMA and we walked over to the Peet's since it was super close to his office.  It's always awesome to catch up and get some mentoring in and I'm always happy to make the trek downtown to do so.

I ordered the hazelnut latte and we headed into the public seating area just outside to chat.  The latte wasn't really constructed with a great deal of care, but it tasted pretty good nonetheless.  It was like, heat milk, poor, done, and dumped on the counter where it spilled a little over the side.  These are just nit-picky things, but still important for the customer experience.

This particular location doesn't have outdoor seating but does have the huge "patio" space in the lobby of the building it's in.  It's indoors so I don't think your dog is welcome there though.  It is however, a great place to hang out and get work done, or even have a meeting like we were having.  I dig it and look forward to going back!

Food: 7/10

Service: 6/10

Price: $

Atmosphere: 7/10
author: Joe M.

description:
This is the Peet's that nobody can seem to find when I say "meet me at the Peet's on Mission at 2nd Street" - invariably people find the Peet's on Market and 2nd or the Peet's on Mission and 3rd Street because apparently the Peet's on Mission is hard to find. Is it? It's on Mission Street. It's tucked behind a giant glass terrarium containing people drinking coffee and talking at the corner of Mission and 2nd Street.

Good service. Great coffee. Great people work and come here consistently. Grab a WiFi code with your coffee and sit in the terrarium/atrium of the corner building at Mission and 2nd Street - it's a great place to have a coffee meeting or just chill with a laptop.
author: Angie C.

description:
Why 4 stars?  Because...oh you're about to find out.

   ---   ---   ---

This review may just change the internet forever.  

When we are being dissected by alien lifeforms in the year 2385, I am certain that these few sentences will live on and be included as highlights of the 400 year run of the internet.  Yes, this review will be mentioned with the Internet's historic events such as: Twitter's reaction to the death of Michael Jackson, the first skype chat that transports matter, and the day that Myspace becomes the first non-human president. (Yep, who would have thought?)

So without further adieu, the two reasons I enjoy Peet's:

1) It is a lot better than Starbucks.

2) We don't have Peet's in Tampa, so it feels like a mom and pop joint...which makes it scientifically taste better.


Thank you, thank you.  This is why I was chosen by Yelp.  Please ensure that my grave has "May 1, 2012: Greatness."
author: Brett N.

description: I have a feeling that I'll be spending a lot of time at the Peet's in the near future.  It has a lot of space and the staff is kind, they are clearly busy because at 9 am most of their pastry case was cleared out.  The store seemed a little messy but staff was walking around cleaning up.
author: Stephanie D.

description:
Pretty small Peet's compared to other ones in FiDi, but quality is not compromised. Stopped by on my way to work today and got a small Matcha Green Tea Latte. Baristas were friendly and worked swiftly.

While there is WiFi here, there are very few spots to sit at. 

Nice coffee break during the day.
author: Rachel C.

description: This Peet's is a hot mess. I wish someone from corporate would straighten this one out.  I've worked across the street for three years, and during the last couple of years things have really gone downhill. The quality of the coffee drinks is so hit or miss. And the area where they make the drinks looks pretty dirty.
author: T. S.

description:
The LONG line in the morning goes pretty quickly and the staff is VERY friendly.. nice way to start the morning.

My only gripe is if the friendly cashier could NOT call me "baby". Thanks.
author: Melody T.

description:
In terms of American cafe chains Peets is doing alright by me.

Their coffee like most American cafes leaves something to be desired, but they have a berrytastic range of scones which I appreciated and devoured.

Plus the staff were really lovely.
author: Laura D.

description: Angry barista. Yelled at me for not saying "Thank you" loud enough to him for making my coffee (I just gave him a nod as I was finishing my email when he called my name to pick up coffee..) Really?? Take it easy dude - this is just coffee. The company should check the emotional state of their baristas when hiring. Thanks!
author: Lynn H.

description: If you stop by this place at 6:30 am on Sunday you would listen to classic music and Walter ( the Batista) singing - it's a very positive way to start your morning))) + LARGE AMERICANO
author: George B.

description: I guess she wast having a very good morning because I asked her how was she doing and never got a answer. The little short girl with the glasses is rude and will rush you if you take to long don't go to her she not helpful at all. This location needs to do better I won't return! There are way too many other coffee bars serving better espresso drinks and they have the service to go along with it.
author: Adrian C.

description:
I agree with Myke that the morning team includes some newbies.  That said, the place just opened some 3 or 4 days ago so I think it's fair to give them time to learn the ropes.

Then again, my order was pretty damn straightforward:  large coffee and a cream currant scone.    I'm very pleased that I actually have a Peet's coffee right in my building.   Still, that's troubling too.  Their coffee is serious rocket fuel and I could very well see myself getting an ulcer from drinking too much of it.    Still, on a day like today when I'm tired and need to jump start my brain, there's nothing like Peet's coffee to get the job done!
author: David O.

description:
Even though the line looks long, the staff is super quick and super friendly.

Once right after I paid, my mocha, was already ready.  Great way to start my workday. =)
author: Panda G.

description:
So you get off at Montgomery for work, and you need your coffee, but you'd prefer more than Muni-station ambiance with your latte?  No worries, there's a new Peet's topside (although one year in, they've only got 3 Yelp reviews, despite being the only downtown Peet's actually on Market.  Is this a sign of market saturation?)  It's tucked into a distinctive wedge space just below 2nd St, with a generous covered patio area where you can watch the street life.  The inside is cozy; a little too cozy in fact, because there's hardly room for a proper line.  I came at lunchtime but I wonder how they handle the 9 AM rush.

PS if your Peet's count hits 18, does that mean you're old enough to vote on your favorite?  Nah, better wait till I've sampled the remaining 5...
author: Wes M.

description:
The coffee and coffee drinks at this Peet's are as fabulous as any Peet's I've been to anywhere.  This one excels because the staff is better than pleasant, they are kind and funny people.  They don't get all agitated when there's a sudden rush of not-so-nice lawyers or hyper-hyper techie types.  They are a nice reminder of the humanity of being human when the rest of humanity is into acting like a-holes.  AND they've never once screwed up a latte or mocha of mine.  I walk past other Peet's to get to this one, their drinks are so consistently good...

If you want more deets about this location, there are a few tables inside and a decent number outside.  But the number of days you want to sit it that shady and windy spot are kind of limited.
author: Ted R.

description:
It's a peets. With that said...

I was helped by two really friendly and funny employees, domo and beltran. Will definitely come here again.

Unfortunately there isn't a bathroom
author: Nick M.

description:
Sitting here sippin my latte, people watching and 'puter surfin. 

I love sunny sf days!
author: Lily M.

description: I love this store, the people that work here are super friendly and very helpful. My favorite drink is the loose leaf decaf English breakfast tea with a splash of half and half. Oh don't forget the cream currant scone.
author: Mae D.

description: This is one of my favorite Peets in the city.  It is conveniently located across the street from where I work.  The staff are on top of it even when the line is long.  If you're just going to order a cub of java; you're better off ordering a med size verses a small size.  It's about .20 cents difference and you get more for your buck.  I'm just saying.  Not really a place to kick it but the office building connected has tables and chairs with lots of sun light beaming in.
author: Liz D.

description:
We only have two Peet's in Chicago. TWO. 

Here, I realize it is more of a chain. However, home grown is home grown...and when a place starts somewhere, it counts for something. Right? Ok, well...that's my story. 

1st time: I walked into this place on my first day, of a brand new job, in a city I'd never really been to with a bunch of people I barely knew. I'm a nervous nellie...I was a bit freaked. I approached the counter, and the counter boy said: "Wow, your hair is just fanastic, did you just get it done?" I practically reached across the counter and kissed him. He set the tone, chilled me out, and served me caffeine. And made me feel purdy. 

Now, granted...that was a year ago, and have no idea if this is the same guardian angel of beverages. Let's pretend.  I'm giving this place 4 stars because of the one guy that has served me my coffee THREE mornings in a row this week. Yes, addict up in here. He's so cute. In that sweet, friendly, perfect-coffeeshop-staffer sort of way. I find that one off is a fluke perhaps, 2 times is starting to get familiar and three times is a goddamn miracle of sorts. There have been no hair comments, but the overall niceness is much appreciated. It's like my dad serving me coffee when I'm holed up at home...but this boy is nicer, because my dad is grouchy.

And I generally don't like anyone before 9am, pre-coffee. So, this is monumental. A year later, still all good in the java 'hood.
author: Colleen C.

description:
They haven't kicked me out yet, so I suppose that's a good thing. Seriously though, I spend a lot of time here. Like way too much. Since I don't get out much, I often feel the need to get out of the apt. and into the "real world."

I usually just get black coffee, which is the perfect strength. But I'm also in love with the non-fat sugar-free vanilla latte. I know, It sounds disgusting. It is sooooo good. I honestly think they're lying when they tell me it's non-fat and sugar-free, but what I don't know won't hurt me, right?

I wish Peet's was bigger. Sometimes I have to wait for a seat. And then I feel really bad when I'm sitting for a couple hours and know that I'm taking up room. The staff is always super friendly and like I said, they haven't kicked me out yet.
author: Jeri T.

description: Great tasting coffee and snacks. I stopped here before the giants parade,  great service despite not having a working bathroom.
author: Jacob W.

description:
This place has a photo of their 'customer of the month' - the prerequisites include eye contact, demeanor, and frequency of coming into the store. I won't make this honor since the service wasn't so great.

Peets is not user friendly as a social gathering place- they'll let you use the wifi if you get the code- if you remember to ask for it. ( There's no code at Starbucks )

The coffee at Peets is superior to Sarbucks but these guys didn't give much work into preparing a mocha for me. It was lukewarm at best. I found this out too late of course. But even so, I don't like inconveniencing my fellow customers by drawing attention to failure and thus wasting their time. 

The coffee was passable at the moment so I let it go.

Jm
author: Joe M.

description:
I was specific about what I wanted; the competent looking clerk confirmed my request, and when the drink came out it wasn't flat, it wasn't in a trad cap cup,and once again, I simply rolled my eyes and wondered why I even bother giving instructions to people at Peet's. The drink was fine but it wasn't what I wanted and this is why I seldom visit Peet's anymore-- a place I worked at for nearly two years after the economic crash in 2008. 

OK, I feel better now.
author: Chris J.

description: This is my favorite Peet's!!  These cashiers and baristas are super friendly, make great lattes, and put up with me first thing in the morning when all I can mutter is, "coffeeee?" I won't name names, but they're all great!! In the middle of the work day, when I feel like I am going to bite someone's head off, a warm greeting from the peeps at Peet's sets me straight. Thanks!!! They are also really fast...sometimes too fast!!
author: Jacqueline C.

description:
Peet's my Interest.

This is like any other chain coffee house.  Quick, consistent and busy.  It's a little narrow, but we didn't stick around to experience the atmospere too long.  We hit the streets and were happily warmed by our latte and egg nog latte.

Don't half step.  This is a good go-to when staying at the Hotel Palomar.
author: Brendon D.

description: Ok - long lines at Starbucks so I head to Peets.  I didn't have time to pack breakfast and lunch today.   It's got a line too but moves pretty quickly, it's a little closer to the office so I am seeing coworkers and chatting with them, and before you know it, I've got my iced chai latte and a muffin in hand.  Not the breakfast of champions but good enough for today.
author: Bebe W.

description:
After our museum trip, I was "need a nap and fast tired". Unfortunately, I knew this wasn't going to happen, but fortunately for me, I saw this Peet's on my way down Mission from the Bart station. 

Anyway, this is a small Peet's. It is smaller than the one on Solano Ave. in length, but has more seating inside (maybe 3 tables). There are a couple of outdoor seats as well, but the reason this location gets 4 stars is that they know how to move a crowd through. I am not the most patient person, and when I saw the line 10 people or so deep, I was hesitant to get in line. The drip coffee they were serving was one of the nasty blends, so I opted for my standby-nonfat extra foamy latte. I was impressed at the teamwork at 4pm. I had my perfectly foamy latte in no-time. My companion had her perfect soy latte w/in 5 minutes of ordering as well. It was great.
author: Tam F.

description:
I am officially a regular here now, according to my Yelp app. I don't come here every day but during the holidays, I find myself being drawn in by their delicious gingerbread lattes. And before your know it (actually in just 3 days) the holidays will be over & gingerbread lattes will no longer be relevant. *Sigh* 

I like this Peet's location because it is never as crowded as the one on Market, or the one in the Montgomery Station, or the one 2 blocks over on 3rd. Plus it's right across the street from my office. I think there are actually more Peet's than Starbucks in this particular part of town. Amazing but true! 

The employees are friendly & pleasant & always get my order right. This is my go-to place for a morning latte treat.
author: Erin S.

description:
Starbuck's is a costly, crowded,  McDonald's "omni present"  400 pound gorilla. The "Walmart of coffee" is just not that good. Pete's is not the best in the world, but certainly a better cup of coffee than Dr. Evil's front company.

This location at the base of the Paramount has a fantastic crew and as my good man Jeremy stated in his review the lines do move quickly. Pete's is an early morning aid station for post Yelp Elite party hangovers.
author: Michael G.

description:
You know when Catweazle stumbles into the 20th century from Medieval times and mistakes modern technology for powerful magic, waxing emotional about 'the telling bone' and 'electrickery'? Forget an Englishman in New York, that's a Mancunian in Peet's.

I think we need a symbiotic cuddle, America. I know I need one because our coffee officially does suck, you were right all along - Peet's has made me see the way clearly. And you need one because I know you want to come visit us in our castles (we all have one) with our mushy peas and our cobbled streets, and that's lovely, but I'm sorry, US of A... *weeps and splutters* I'm so ashamed... I'm so ashamed of our inferior beans, I... *descends into sobs* Hold me!

Considering the first ever 'coffee shop' as we now know them started in Britain, that's shameful. Why exactly have we been peddling mudwater ever since?

Californian Coffee. Berkeley Beans. Kind of roll off the tongue really, don't they. Right next door to the city from whence it came, this branch of Peet's is located handily across from the office I was spending most of my SFO week in. Now, you might wonder why I was sniffling so much before, but chain-wise, we have limitations on this tiny collection of islands we call the UK. Starbucks. Costa. Nero. Republic. Am I missing any? Barely. Peet's is one of those small (and perfectly formed) high quality chains we just don't experience, and right from the moment I entered and saw the huge hunks of cake, the hip young baristas with friendly smiles, the locals publicly writing on their laptops (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=12JTDp6xm18), I knew this was my kind of place.

I only ordered a peppermint tea but my two compadres hit the caffeine and were muchly impressed. As for my herbal infusion, it was lush. One of the nicest I'd ever had, and they even gave me a spare teabag to either make mine stronger or fashion my own at home. Oh, the loveliness. Peet's. you're one of the many things making me reverse-homesick. And you were part of the swinging sixties movement too. Sheesh. Can you DO no wrong?
author: Emma Louise M.

description:
Love coffee drinks.  I tend to prefer Frappachinos over whatever Peet's equivalent is, but for the products they make, I like em.  Wish they weren't so expensive, though.

Tip:  When you make a purchase, ask them for a wifi access code so you can hop on the wifi while you're waiting or while you're enjoying your beverage/treat.
author: Wyman L.

description: This Peets is fine with its coffees. But there were bugs all over the pastries around 430 when I came in. Fruit flies. Not the cleanest either. Get coffee but little else.
author: Mike H.

description:
Lucky for me, I work directly across the street from this Peet's. The first time I came here, when I walked inside and saw the ginormous line, I almost turned around and walked out. But I really, REALLY wanted my usual small 1 shot vanilla latte, so I sucked it up and jumped in line. To my surprise, I was standing in front of the cashier in less than 3 minutes! And walking out the door, sweet awesome latte in hand in less than 5 TOTAL minutes. 

My drink order has only been messed up once and I come here every day, 5 days a week, and sometimes in the afternoon when the 3pm sleep monster comes to my desk trying to talk me into a nap and I really need some caffeine to keep me going. I took my drink back and Matthew kindly apologized, made me a new drink the right way and even gave me a coupon good for one free medium drink of my choice for my next visit. Now THAT's customer service.
author: Jen D.

description: My favorite. Hook it to my veins! Friendly staff and the line moves quick.
author: Jeremy S.

description: I really like the adjacent patio area a lot; a great place to catch up with friends.
author: Mel G.

description: And the award for most efficient cafe line in SOMA goes to the talented team at this Peet's. No matter the time of day you all are ON IT.
author: Angelina C.

description: For a SF Peet's very spacious.  I thought it was a bit messy in the milk and sugar area, but service was fast and very nice.
author: Chris R.

description: This Peet's is the best! The baristas here are amazing (especially Dwayne and Francis)!! Per my request, Francis makes me random drink creations and everything he makes is sooo delicious! I'm not even sure if I could go to another Peet's and explain what Francis makes me, but I know my standard is something like "coffee with 2 shots of espresso, milk, and raspberry syrup". It's always the highlight of my morning to come in for a special "Anastasia" drink :). I love their upbeat attitude and delicious drink making skills!! This place has the BEST customer service!!!
author: Anastasia B.

description:
Even on cold, rainy days and the amount of people coming in here for something warm, the service is still efficient and those behind the counter still have smiles on their faces.

Good set of chairs and tables against the front so you can it and meet and enjoy your beverage.  But on those cold rainy days those chairs are a hot commodity.
author: Debbie E.

description: I really enjoy the Peet's atmosphere. Friendly staff. Even when the lines are long, the service is very quick. My favorite drink to get there is the iced caramel latte and it is consistently good.
author: Katrina H.

description:
You would have earned a 4th star if you weren't so damned busy. I mean, come on, in order to make it to work on time in this city you have to block out an extra 15 minutes to get your coffee. Amazingly crowded. Jeeez.

But, once you've sipped the light and frothy foam that's lovingly dolloped onto the perfectly brewed espresso shot you understand why there are hoards of coffee devotees, ugh, I guess, Peets devotees....it's too damn delicious. Caffeinated heaven.
author: sarah p.

description:
This Peet's was my first visit at a Peet's since the godawful latte I received at a Los Angeles area Peet's some time ago (refer to previous review).

I went in because I just had to have a gingerbread latte, and I knew only Peet's would have it. I was prepared for the rest of the drink to suck. However, it was pure perfection. The espresso was yummy, the foam was fluffly, the temperature was just right (I always burn myself on Starbucks drinks...) and the gingerbread tasted great.

This Peet's turned me into a Peet's fan and I now hardly go to Starbucks when I want a latte. Not only is Peet's cheaper, they have way more syrups, and their espresso is much smoother. I've yet to try their whole bean coffees to brew at home but I'm sure that's in my future.

Minus one star for the rude girl that sometimes works there around closing time, and the fact that she doesn't know how to make foam.
author: Love X.

description: BEST PEET'S EVER.  And I love Peet's like I love myself.  The staff at this particular Peet's has got to be the cream of the crop.  Always a smile, remember my name, remember what I usually drink.  I like to throw them off every once in a while and deviate from my usual 'small in a large' coffee.  In particular Francis is the coolest, best ever!  This man can make the best espresso drinks ever.  I can think of one thing, and one only, that is better the first thing in the morning.  hee hee hee...
author: J B.

description:
The attractive blonde barista offered me an extra shot of espresso for my Americano and now I'm at work about to go bonkers.

Dear 1992, please leave some Ninja Turtles Pizza and Crystal Pepsi out. I'm coming to see you.
author: Keane L.

description:
I really hope that there isn't an earthquake while I'm down here and this Peet's get smashed to the ground, because even if I survived the 'quake, I would still die without this Peet's.

This Peet's is my life support system. When I get 15 minutes to "relax" I run here as fast as my little legs will carry me, pant out my order of a double tall vanilla soy latte, and then vacuum seal my mouth to the cup. 

Ahhhhh...
author: Michelle B.

description:
I walked in this place today and started hyperventilating.
This was the scene of the crime.  I totally forgot that it was THIS Peet's, and I hoped they had too.

Here is what happened.
Years ago, before I even worked in the FiDi, my dad and i were cruising around downtown, and saw Peet's and stopped in for a delicious coffee and a hot tea.  In my green tea, I require honey, and that's when it started to go downhill.  Their honey was in one of those really nice glass syrup holders.  You know, the kind they have at IHOP?  So, I was turning to grab the jar, and because I had a huge purse on, my perception was off, the bag hit the holder, and the honey shattered on the floor into a sticky pile of glass.  Have you ever tried to clean up honey?  Neither have I.  I placed some strategically placed napkins over it, and took off running.

Am I proud? No.  Did I vow to never go back to that Peet's in fear of my being recognized as the girl who shattered the honey jar?  Yes.

But today, I accidentally wandered in, panic set in, and NO ONE recognized me!  So, I think ill be back.  I got an English Breakfast to avoid the use of honey but its a good thing their honey is now in a plastic squeeze bottle.  Probably because of me.
author: Lauren F.

description:
Standard office zombie fuel, it's good for the mornings but I wouldn't go out of my way to drink Peet's. In fairness, I feel roughly the same way about Starbucks (at least they are blatantly trying to create a cafe lifestyle, Peet's just tries to pretend like they're not after that same thing). Both have taken something I really love - good coffee - and taken the soul out of it.

Cafe Madeleine on New Montgomery is my personal preference.
author: Nish N.

description:
Interesting people work here.

One didn't really know how to tally up my total.

One looked as though he hadn't washed his hair in months.

And the other one was able to hand me my blendy funtime drink while simultaneously throwing in a wink.

I gave it 5 stars because I am on a work trip, but I am also on a semi vacation out of LA, so when you see exotic creatures from the North doing everyday things, it at least deserves an A for effort or at the very least, 5 stars.

Oh and the coffee frappy extra loaded vanilla thing wasn't bad either!
author: Stephy S.

description:
i love peet's coffee. i love THIS peet's coffee for two reasons*:

1) geo
2) julian
*absolutely not in order of importance. i love them both equally.

i was "customer of the week" at this peet's and i'm sure i have g and j to thank for that.  it was quite an honor, you know. they posted my photo on the counter for everyone to admire and envy and i got free coffee for a week.  at one time, dave chappelle was also "customer of the week" at this peet's, so obviously it's a lofty title reserved for people of our (dave's and mine) caliber.
really, it may have been the most exciting thing that's happened to me all year. no kidding.  
i wish i could return the favor to g and j.  if alfred h. peet was still alive, i'd write him a letter and tell him he is lucky to have two such fine young men working for him and that he should give them ea. a raise and a lifetime supply of coffee.  
all i have to give to them, though, are my words and this review.  
geo and julian, per this review, i give you the title, "coffee guys of the millenium"!

and...errrr.,... it's not just all about me and my honorable award.... they really are THE best!
author: Mary C.

description:
Dear Peet,

I would like to formally apologize for bringing my snooty coffee nose into your doors and saying something along the lines of "Northwest represent"...

Please take joy in the fact that I mistook you as one of the admirable small chains among the mecca of coffee roasters to the North, and that I would align you with the greats of Vivace and Stumptown. 

But brown nosing aside, I was quickly and firmly corrected by my co-worker who said: "ahh..hmm...Laura...Peet's is from HERE".

I stand corrected.  Berkeley - represent.  (You certainly  did against those Ducks last week). I had it coming.
author: Laura N.

description:
Dear Peet's Coffee I love you. But I kinda hate you at the same time. 

As I sit at my computer, attempting to be productive, all I can think about is how I want to have my own personal dance party in the conference room due to the exceptionally amazing (and strong) white non-fat iced mocha that you provided me. I can't stop drinking it, but it is encouraging this ridiculous, jittery feeling that I can't escape. As I was explaining to coworker it's just so tasty, there is no way you can stop. Which is why I love Peet's in a special way that also includes a smidgen of hatred. 

Seriously though, this Peet's is awesome. The staff is super nice, they move quickly even when the line is practically out the door, and the drinks are excellent. You occasionally even see a cute SOMA professional, which in itself is an added bonus. Oh and this amazing public atrium is next door which is beyond perfection for people watching and sitting at lunch. They open the doors when the weather gets nice as well as host fun events. 

Power to the Peet's at the corner of Mission and 2nd! I love-hate you more than I can say...
author: Marissa R.

description:
Today I learned I've been to a shit-ton of Peets and Yelped em good.
Yup.
Good, hard and long and when then begged me to stop I said, "hell no" and flipped them over.

This is one of many. And I am a Peets fan, I guess. At least that is what the numbers suggest.
As for this one, it is small and doesn't have a public restroom.
But still better than, say one in an airport or mall.
author: JAYCE B.

description: This Peet's has much more room for seating than some of the other ones, which is a key driver for coffee shop success =)
author: Mike G.

description: This location is in the middle of financial district so there will be a nice line in morning and 3pm break time.  Otherwise it's great service and great coffee!
author: Dagny C.

description:
I'm a fiend for caffeine.

Good coffee. Their soy milk is good quality. What really stands out at this particular location is the customer service. There is NOTHING more important to me than good customer service. I will sacrifice quality to be treated with some respect and appreciation. Fortunately, here, I don't have to make that sacrifice.
author: Kiersten S.

description: Decided to try this place for the first time since there are so many around this area. I got the mocha expresso...I don't think it tastes as good as Starbucks coffee. It's definitely much better than coffee from my office. I had higher expectations for this place though.
author: Liwei Y.

description:
Peet, you couldn't be any closer unless you were in my building!

The coffee maker is broken at work so I had the chance to come visit you this morning.  Thanks for the vanilla latte!
See you tomorrow?!
author: Lauren C.

description: All is well in my world I got my daily Jasmine Pearl Tea (extra strong) - Thank you Peet's!  :)'
author: Rich W.

description:
Throw away your starbucks cards folks.  This is one helluva cup.  Ron (or *Raughn*) is fantastic and can barrista your pants off.  Long lines move fast.
One of the new guys though consistently gets my name wrong so I've started messing with him.
author: Meg W.

description: The employee's here are definitely awesome. They seem like they're enjoying their job and it really shows because they smile at you in the morning and rather than chit chatting with each other, they chat with you. The manager is on the floor helping instead of telling their employees what to do. Quick even on a busy Monday morning and I think it's great. No one likes Mondays, but they're on it! This crazy guy came in while I was sipping on my caramel latte and started yelling *beep beeeep* at the manager. I would've cussed back at him, but the manager took it very well and told him to leave, turned around, smiled, and continued to help his customers. A+ for customer service! :)
author: Wendy L.

description:
This is a difficult review to write.   I say that because i love Peet's coffee and at every other location I've been to, I've had an amazing experience.   Today, however, seemed like a day where EVERYONE in the store was new.  

First, i got in there and it didn't seem too busy.   There was a line of people waiting for their "special" drinks, be it the mocha or the frappa or the cappa...whatever, thats common.  Those drinks take time, i understand.   I ordered a some what basic medium coffee with an add shot.  I was thinking it would take a minute / two minutes max.   I'm not a Blue Bottle, they're not doing the individual drip, it's pre-made, just throw in the espresso.  

6 minutes later the espresso shows up sans house coffee....another minute later the coffee shows up.   I think the reason this is baffling to me is that there were 8 people working this morning in a fairly high trafficked area and none of them seemed to have had a clue.   

Also, i'm dinging this Peet's for how they handled a spill.   Apparently, someone had dropped their Foam drink and it spilled everywhere.  Rather than grabbing a mop and mopping it up quickly.   One of the Marvelous 8 attempted to clean it up with a rag, stopped, had to go get another rag, continue cleaning, stop, fetch another rag.   I would say this took a good 8-10 minutes.  I'm basing that on him already cleaning when i came in and finished just before i left.   I'm pretty sure there is a mop somewhere in that establishment.

Sorry Peet's, I love your Joe, but your morning crew needs to get their act together.
author: Myke H.

description: another cup of hot chocolate on field trip to test out consistency of peets hot chocolate before i catch hell for drinking sugary drinks on the job on tuesday
author: Sin D.

description:
I love Peets! Their coffee is so rich and flavorful. I hit this up every morning when we visit the city. Nice little walk from the W, order my large black, and then enjoy in the Living Room.

It seems that Peets baristas actually care about their job, and it doesn't have the fast food feel of some of the other coffee chains.
author: Kelsey G.

description:
Wake up, grind coffee, add water, take shower, drink coffee. Get to work, head to Peets. Almost awake now. So by 10am I've had about 2 cups of Peets. The people are nice. The coffee is good. I don't go after the "coffee drinks", just drip.

My usual is major dickason and Ethiopian. I've never had a horrible drip coffee from peets. But I do stay away from sumatra.
author: Bruce B.

description:
SOOOOO happy to have a Peet's barely more than an elevator ride away! It's my escape when I just need to get away from my desk for a few minutes and grab a cuppa that doesn't taste like a mug full of acid like Office Coffee does.

Bonus points because some of the staff already remember my drink AND my name!
author: Victoria K.

description:
I've made the trek up 2nd st. from BART every day for the last eight months, and somehow have never noticed, until today, that there is a Peet's coffee just off 2nd on Mission. 

This is an important discovery for two reasons:

- Red Tea (Rooibos)

- Lemon Scones

I have scoured the area for coffee shops that serve either, but have been constantly disappointed. I've even asked many of them to start carrying either, and have been disappointed. But today I found Peet's, and the heavens opened up and rained down both red tea and a lemon scone.
author: C D.

description:
Two Words: Celebrity Customers.

[Allegedly, Dave Chappelle is a regular]
author: Pete J.

description:
Ummm...I am not sure if they are supposed to remember me if there is a new person behind the counter everyday.

BUT I have to say that this is one of those places that I developed a rather strong affection for on my every day walk to work. 

I always sneer at how many people are in line but undoubtedly and consistently it moves incredibly quick every time!! Oh and one more thing, DEBRA should be the woman of the year here...that's all I'm gonna say!
author: Yelper A.

description:
Eh, Peet's is Peet's. I like their beverages. But the staff at this specific Peet's is WONDERFUL! They're fun and personable and they SMILE *gasp*

And when I ask for my drink to be 140 degrees, it's 140.00 degrees, dammit. (Or at least, I like to believe so.)
author: Patricia E.

description: Happy Customer of the Week to me! Peet's is the best because they forgive me when I say "tall or grande" and are always super nice. Hooray for yummy espresso & Peet's!
author: E H.

description: Living in Phoenix for the past 8 years I had heard the legend of Peet's Coffee & Tea and wondered could coffee really be that good? Well, it's my first week of living in SF and I have an answer... Hell YES! Starbucks you've got nothing on Peet's!!!
author: Leanne S.

description: I normally make a point to not frequent chain coffee shops, but sometimes I wake up for work and am too tired to make my own coffee at home. I'm so tired that I don't even realize how tired I am until I get to my office and realize that I can't figure out how to make my elevator card key work. That's when I cross the street to Peets and get those nice baristas to make me a huge coffee. When I come here, I always think about how much I hated my life when I was a barista and how shitty I was to my customers as a result. But these guys and gals behind the counter are never anything but friendly to me. I find this really note-worthy because I'm sure it sucks 10 times as hard to serve coffee for a corporation, working under surveillance cameras and all. And while those cameras might be the reason they're smiling all the time, I don't care. I still tip my hat to them.
author: Rebecca P.

description:
There used to be a florist in this little wedge space at 595 Market, between Stacey's Bookshop and the bank. It was never really prominent and when that business closed and the boards went up to say there's a Peet's being built... I was jumping for joy!!

Not to degrade any of the existing coffee establishments - there's a good Martha & Bros around the corner, as well as a friendly enough Starbucks across the road (though I have a chronic dislike of Starbucks) - I *heart* Peet's. It is the mass chain as close to Italian deli coffee that I'm used to from Australia.

This Peet's location has became the hottest hang out of my office (which is located in 2 doors down). Peet's gift card was the hottest White Elephant gift this year.

As for me? I am thankful of a sweet girl making coffee this morning... stunning soy latte where the soy milk is not burnt. Woo hoo!
author: Joyce L.

description: Very sweet and laided back, not quick but good. Thanks for letting me have the extra tea bag when I just wanted one and paid for two. Nice touch.
author: Natasha M.

description: This Pete's is adjacent to a clean and bright public atrium where you can enjoy your coffee or conduct a business meeting sheltered from the elements (natural or otherwise) outside.  For my purposes, this makes it far more attractive than a smaller, darker cafe that might serve slightly better joe.
author: Geoff D.

description:
A giant dose of caffeine.  

The line at this location tends to be shorter than many of the other Peets nearer to my office, so I sometimes prefer to buy coffee here. 

Only thing this location lacks is a restroom.
author: Sooj O.

description: This Peet's is so inconsistent service wise that it's actually really starting to frustrate me. I live upstairs so it's been my go-to coffee spot for a while now and they still have no idea who I am (I drink the same thing every day). Sometimes the staff are friendly and I'm in and out with a relatively pleasant experience. No complaints. Other times, it seems that speaking to me or showing any kind of pleasantries is such a laborious task that the staff simply avoids it. The other day, I walked up to the counter and the employee on the register just looks at me. No words. So after an awkward silence, I proceeded to order. Still no words. So I handed over my money. Still no words. Another awkward silence. I say "...Thanks...". Aaakward silence. I leave and walk over to wait for my drink. Seriously lady?! The money I'm paying for my overpriced latte in turn pays for your ridiculous hairdo and fake hipster glasses and you can't even force a "hello" none the less a smile? I'd say this is about my experience 50% of the time. Luckily for them, they make a consistently wonderful soy latte.
author: Heather U.

description:
I'm so happy there's now a Peet's near the Flood Building.  No more Charbucks!  Actually, the Organic Cafe at 5th and Mission is really good, but sometimes I just get a hankering for that Peet's flavuh kick.  You know what I mean.

I like Peet's.
author: Abendigo R.

description:
Im a self proclaimed coffee snob...and that comes purely as a result of I myself having been a barista at a traditional Italian coffee joint so I got pretty spoiled.  Peet's is meh in my opinion, I actually only go here when its freezing outside and I don't feel like walking outside (I work in the building this Peet's is in so its quite convenient).

I don't know if its that they buy cheap coffee or that their baristas have no clue how to pull a decent shot, but their espresso always tastes bitter.  A good shot of espresso should taste full and earthy with a slight bitter taste.  Peet's just tastes watery and bitter...bleh.  Plus I feel they are a bit overpriced, last week I paid $4.00 for a small soy latte....WTF?! Did I step into Starbucks by mistake?  Maybe its just my bad memory, but I thought Peet's used to be cheaper.  Oh well.

I will give them props for always having a wonderful and helpful staff.  They are always fabulous and I got to give them major points for that.  Also they do have some pretty good teas, not the finest in town but better than most coffee  joints.  FYI in the summer, get their mango iced tea. Im not much for fruit flavored teas,  but this one is delicate and beautiful.
author: Seana L.

description: This is hands down this BEST Peet's in the sf!! I say that having been to almost all of them in the city! I will even plan my evening commute around going to this location! I love coffee and since I don't drink soda, alcohol, tea or juice (except for OJ), coffee and water are really all that's left for me to drink. Now you know how you have your favorite barista and your favorite coffee shop, well here they're ALL great! My drink is a pain in the a@# to make and normally when I order it everyone behind the counter (and some behind me) rounds their eyes, their eyes bug out in shock or there's some sort of combination of those with a side of judgment, but not here! I can proudly ask (well I don't have to ask anymore b/c they know my favorites and now they just ask if i want hot or cold) for my large, iced, 13 pump vanilla, and breve (half & half creamer) latte or my med coffee in a large cup add 12 pumps of vanilla and lots of room coffee without shame. The drink is always made right and great! They are always super friendly and b/c they know i work around the corner and i only have a 10 min break they start making my drink as I walk in!! Is that not the best service you've ever heard of!? And at a chain?! Normally at places like Starbucks they may remember your name but the friendliness is so transparent and insincere they might as well not and act like I'm just anything face in the crowd b/c that other stuff is kinda creepy!
author: Shannon E.

description: Okay, seriously -- in an economic climate where many businesses are downsizing or closing their doors altogether, how is it that Peet's keeps opening new locations? I mean, this is the second newbie in the FiDi within a month's time, plus there is a shiny new one poised to open on Van Ness at Bush on my way home. Don't get me wrong -- I'm not faulting them. As a chai-loving coffee-hater, Peet's is my favorite local tea vendor, but it does leave me scratching my noggin. As for this latest one, it is right next door to Stacey's Books AND has the cutest little courtyard ever, so I'm totally into it. Grand opening special ends tomorrow, betches, so git it!
author: Gregor G.

description: The staff may be friendly, and the line moves quick. But that's because they do a lousy job on the coffee. Try ordering a Trad-Cap and you still get the usual cup-o-foam.  There are plenty of other Peet's that do a better job a few blocks away.
author: Jeremy P.

description: What can I say? The coffee isn't fantastic, but it's across the street from the office and the baristas have recognized me to the point where they will begin pouring out a small coffee as soon as I enter. It's also a great way for me to get rid of exactly 70 cents in change every day.
author: Daniel C.

description: Da Bomb!  Went today to try out the Vanilla Latte.  Since I've had some coffee bar experience (aka Starbuko's) I axed, how many pumps of syrup do y'all put?  She informed me 4 so I said let me just have 2, extra hot, non-fat.  Dagnabit, the best latte EVER...  well almost ever cause no one beats IL Fornaio coffee shop in Vegas!  Oh and if you're a fan of theirs on facebook they have a 2 for 1 coupon right now...
author: La C.

description: I can't help it.  Peet's is so good.  It's the only place in the U.S. where they make the right kind of cappucino.  Every time I come back to the Bay Area, it's the first place we hit.  I know, I know, they sell it at Safeway now, but I'm convinced the beans are still fresher in the store.  At Sbucks, they scald the milk because they are rushing to get everything ready, and they overroast the coffee to cover up the less appealing flavours.  Peet's is always excellent... even in the airport!  Hooray for a small hardworking business that made it big.  But not too big.
author: David M.

description: Love love love Peet's and this location! I've converted over to Peet's from Starbucks because the coffee must have some kind of crack in it. My sugar-free vanilla latte really gives me a kick in the ass in the morning and I get so much work done! I try to go here only twice a week since it gets pretty $$. Somedays you'll catch the barista singing, one morning he was singing a song from Space Jams. It put a smile on my face...lol  My goal is to be customer of the week but I guess that means I have to go there everyday...maybe once the economy picks up..
author: Bj S.

description: Good coffee and friendly staff at this location.  The line is fairly long between 8 and 9 (just like everywhere else), but they work it fairly quickly.
author: Tim S.

description: 6/15/08: Thanks for opening on a Sunday morning around 7am - gotta love their coffee and their dedication to their customers.
author: Jesse W.

description: Not being a red blooded american, I don't much care for coffee. I prefer Tea (oh yeah! wanna make something of it!), and Peet's has some ok teas. As good as one could expect from such a place. The prices are a bit high for what you get; however, would certainly go here over Starbucks.
author: Samuel S.

description:
i would've given this place 5 stars only "peets girlfriend" no longer works here, as well as about 6-7 other really nice, cool, "worth your while for a visit" peets employees.  

3 months ago i could have walked in and everyone knew my name.... and my order.  i frequent this place 2x's a day (morning, lunch), and always got tip top service.  then they all started disappearing and being replaced by new faces... none of which took the same time/consideration to make my visit as special as before.  you can just tell that their chemistry isn't as good as the old batch of peets people.  oh well!

they still make good lattes... good enough that i can't not go!

**3 months later**
nothing has changed.  i still miss the old peets people.  actually, i know where a few of them work now (no i'm not a stalker!) so at least they're on a better path.  the drinks are still good so i still frequent a few times a week... oh well!
author: KL S.

description:
My favorite.  I stop here every morning before work.  They know me and my order.  They even ask where I've been if I skip a day - that's enough to put a smile on your face even on the worst of mornings.

The layout of this Peet's is nice too - people flow in and out fairly easily.  Other Peet's have some crowding issues - which is not so nice first thing in the AM.
author: Jocelyn D.

description: They do a good English Breakfast tea. Unlike most things, I am somewhat discerning in this matter.
author: Bob G.

description: I've kicked coffee so for me iced tea is a big deal.  Peet's consistently has the best iced tea in the area.  It's always fresh and very strong so that after the ice melts a while it's perfect.
author: Matt G.

description: I go here before my class at Golden Gate University, just so I can make it though a 2 1/2 hour lecture ... and that's after work!  I get  a 4 shot, large, lowfat latte or mocha, and a walnut snickerdoodle, and I can make it through about 30 minutes of lecture before I need another.  I am totally immune to caffiene.  If I feel generous, but ONLY if ... I will get a pound of beans for the office.  Major D's blend!  BUT ... most of the staff thinks it's soooo cold in the office, and me being always warm, I like it cool.  They crank the heat to 85 ... so I say ...  PUT ON A FRIGGIN JACKET IF YOU ARE SO COLD.  So, I will not provide good coffee for them ... they can have Folgers, while I sip my Cafe Bello!
author: Michael M.

description:
me:  "here's your tea."
boyfriend:  "what kind did you get me?"
me:  "russian caravan!"
boyfriend:  "russian caravan?"
me:  "yeah, sounded exotic!"
boyfriend:  "oh, yeah smells like a caravan, all right...like a camel's ass."
me:  "really?  what does it taste like?"
boyfriend:  "not really camel's ass...more like urine soaked hay in a barn with chicken shit."
me:  "oh, sorry.  well, my coffee is good!  you want some?"
author: Tabatha Y.

description: I visted this Peet's on new year's eve because I had to kill some time and it was FREEZING outside. It was the middle of the afternoon and desserted. That was great, because - no line! As I was sitting there, sipping my chai latte and burning my tongue, the quietness kinda got to me. I kept thinking they were gonna close cuz they kept cleaning. The latte was ok not special not bad but I would try it again because I had a cold and my taste buds may have been deadened. All in all, a good place to sit and kill some time with a book.
author: Merredith L.

description: If this were a movie the bad guy would be Starbucks, hell bent on world domination and the good guy would be Peet's saving us from the green mermaid's tyrannical rule. Their coffee is brewed with jet fuel and the help is always friendly. Their waiting line kind of sucks in the one downtown, though.
author: Michael E.

description: This is a spacious Peet's and with high ceiling. And as usual, coffee is strong and I have to always ask for a single shot (typical is double.) You can spend good amounts of time to choose the good selection of loose leaf tea without blocking others in line.
author: T L.

description: My office loves coffee. So, I drop in and order beans for the week. I usually hold up the line and I'm pretty sure that the coffee drinkers behind me are thinking bad thoughts about me.  So, Peet's assistant manager, Jessica, has hooked me up with the private bat line.  I can call, place my order, and drop in pick up my bags of coffee.  I'm sure that has to make everyone in the SOMA area happy!
author: Valarie A.

description: I go here like twice a day.  High quality full-bodied espresso.  They recently raised their prices, so a medium vanilla latte is like $3.50, which seems kinda expensive for a coffee drink if you ask me. Coffee at luxury prices sucks! Don't they know we need it every morning?  Medium americano is still under $2.00 at least.
author: Brandon B.

description: I love me my peets.  the people here are always cool and remember the regulars.  i love me peets.  before work, on break, during lunch, on my 2nd break, and during meetings.  despite long lines during morning rush hour, it moves relatively fast, god bless them.  it's always a trip watching people in the mornin' before they've had they're caffeine fix...sort of like watching crackheads in line before their methodone.  no offense.
author: Adrian N.

description: If you've read my question post, you know I am a Dunkin Donuts addicted coffee maven. So trying to find a decent cup o joe in SFO has been nothing but next to impossible. Now Peets isn't bad...for a regular cup of mild. My experience with Peets from Boston was not as promising so something has had to have happened between Boston and here. But not a lot. I'll probably stick to my 7-11 am jolt. But now and again, particularly at the ferry terminal, I'll grab a cup of mild.
author: Anthony F.

description: Peet's is just a little less convenient for me than Starbucks up the street- but SO much better.  The cashiers are friendly and polite for one thing.  And if you have not had their low-fat pumpkin muffin, you better get your butt over there.  That sh*t is good!!
author: CAKE E.

description: Despite the fact that they can never remember my friggin' name, it's reliable.  I wish they would stay open on weekends!
author: Max L.

description: In my opinion, the barristas at this Peet's are some of the best in the Bay Area. The one who looks like Kevin Klein makes espresso drinks that somehow, magically, taste 2x better than the Peet's I go to in Berkeley.
author: Pat T.

description:
my favorite peet's in the city.

i have to come here once a week for a client meeting and the highlight of my afternoon is the fact that everyone at this location can make a bone dry cappuccino.  believe me, people, this is a serious coup. even blue bottle is a little shaky.

and now that we're rapidly approaching tis' the season time, i'll be switching up my usual for the peet's peppermint mocha.  which so isn't my thing normally but i love the peet's version because it's not sweet.  at all.  yummy!
author: nic f.

description: Lunch Time= after meal delicious Peet's coffee (the best coffee of coffee chain coffees) sitting on their outdoor chairs in the warm sun, people watching, relaxing, whatever. The sun is abundant as there is no shade at this corner. I have never had to wait longer than one customer for my coffee. I love it!
author: Rada I.

description: I love getting my morning coffee here. It's always nice and fresh. Too bad they don't serve Holiday Blend anymore... Way better than Starbucks.
author: Jelly G.

description:
Ok, so I tried Peet's a while back and remembered I hated it because it was way too strong and smelled like pot (no kidding - it does!).  I like pot, but not in my coffee.  Now because I hate Starbucks even more, I decided to try some tea here at Peet's.  Not bad!  Can't remember what I had,but it tasted really nice.  

So, 3 stars for good tea and nice people.
author: James B.

description:
I get a drink every morning before work.  I used to go exclusively to Peet's.  Then one day, after yet another humiliating experience, I decided it wasn't worth it.  I have switched to Starbucks and couldn't be happier.

My first bad experience at Peet's was in 1994.  I was new to Peet's then.  I ordered a vanilla latte.  With all the scorn she could muster, the counter person yelled, "Peet's doesn't sell flavored drinks. "  They did sell mochas, but I guess the counter person forgot that chocolate is a flavor.

I tried to put that experience behind me, but I have had several other humiliating Peet's experiences since then.  I have had hundreds of good drinks from them, but it takes a hundred good drinks to make up for the one time when everything goes to hell.  They never seem to get ahead of the ration of bad drinks to good drinks.  I've just had enough of their snobby hatefulness.  Done with Peet's.

Starbucks might not be super delicious, but they treat me fairly.
author: AG O.

description: this is one of my favorite places to go when my afternoon coffee break needs to be a little longer than across the street.  consistent in quality- which is always a plus.  and if you are going to hit a chain, i'd take peet's over starbucks any day of the week.  plus the coffee is better than starbucks, so that helps.  a lot.
author: Samantha W.

description: i love peets. they always make my peppermint mocha with perfection here and service is always great.
author: Heather S.
